formName: Register for corporation tax if you are a non-resident

sections.title: About you

fields.infoText:
Provide the contact details of someone authorised to discuss this form with HMRC. 

We will contact this person if we have a question about this registration.

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: For UK numbers include the area code, for example 020 7946 0000

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will also use this to send you a confirmation email

fields.label: Select the role relevant to you
fields.helpText: You must be one of the following to register on behalf of your business

sections.title: Do you have a Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?

fields.helpText: This is on tax returns and other letters about Corporation Tax. It may be called ‘reference’, ‘UTR’ or ‘official use’.

sections.title: What is your Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?

fields.label: What is your Corporation Tax Unique Taxpayer Reference?
fields.helpText: A Unique Taxpayer Reference is 10 numbers like 12345 67890. It will be on tax returns and other letters about Corporation Tax. It may be called 'reference', 'UTR' or 'official use'.

sections.title: What is your company name?

fields.label: If your company name has changed since you last registered it will not be updated in other government services.
fields.infoText: If your company name has changed since you last registered it will not be updated in other government services.

sections.title: What is your company name?
Do you have an employer PAYE reference number?

fields.label: Do you have an employer PAYE reference number?
fields.helpText: This is a 3 digit tax office number, a forward slash, and a tax office employer reference, like 123/AB456. It may be called ‘Employer PAYE reference’ or ‘PAYE reference’. It will be on your P60.

sections.title: What is your Employer PAYE reference?

fields.label: What is your Employer PAYE reference?
fields.helpText: This is a 3 digit tax office number, a forward slash, and a tax office employer reference, like 123/AB456. It may be called ‘Employer PAYE reference’ or ‘PAYE reference’. It will be on your P60.

sections.title: Does your company have an HMRC reference number?

fields.helpText: If you have registered for an HMRC service your company will have a reference number. For example this could be your non-resident Capital Gains Tax or Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings reference.

sections.title: Provide your HMRC reference details

fields.label: Type of reference
fields.helpText: This could be your non-resident Capital Gain Tax reference, Annual Tax on Enveloped Dwellings reference or VAT reference number

sections.title: Enter your company's incorporation details

fields.label: Date of incorporation
fields.helpText: For example, 01 08 2007

fields.label: Enter the country of incorporation
fields.helpText: This is where the company was formed

fields.label: Find out the correct name format for your country
fields.infoText: If you need to find out the correct name format for your country go to ... and search for...

fields.label: Is this the country of tax residence?

sections.title: What is your country of tax residence?

fields.label: What is your country of tax residence?
fields.helpText: Enter the country where the company currently pays tax

sections.title: Registered office address

fields.infoText:
This is the official registration address listed on your country's public register. It is where official communication is sent, for example letters from (HMRC?), your government or tax authority.

(HMRC will send official correspondence to this address?)

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: Include the country code for international numbers

fields.label: Do you have a UK address you would like to use for your Corporation Tax correspondence?

sections.title: UK correspondence address

fields.infoText: We will use this address for your ongoing Corporation Tax correspondence.

fields.label: This address must be published on all correspondence used in the UK.
fields.infoText: This address must be published on all correspondence used in the UK.

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: If you are entering an international number include the country code

sections.title: Company director details
Company director details

fields.label: Do you want to add another director?

sections.title: Company director details

fields.label: Do you want to add another director?

sections.title: Company director details

fields.label: Do you want to add another director?

sections.title: Company director details
What activity do you want to report to HMRC?

fields.label: What activity do you want to report to HMRC?
choices: More than 1 disposal or other business activities

fields.label: UK business activities chargeable to UK Corporation Tax
fields.infoText:
• Selling assets

• Carrying on a business activity such as a trade or professional activity

• Buying and selling goods with a view to making a profit

• Providing services

• Earning interest

• Managing investments

• Receiving any other income

sections.title: Enter the date you came within charge to UK Corporation Tax

fields.label: This is the date the property transferred out of your company's possession
fields.infoText: This is the date the property transferred out of your company's possession

fields.helpText: For example, 01 08 2007

sections.title: Enter the period chargeable to UK Corporation Tax

fields.label: This is the period in which your company plans to conduct business chargeable for UK Corporation Tax.
fields.infoText: This is the period in which your company plans to conduct business chargeable for UK Corporation Tax.

fields.label: Date you came within chargeable to UK Corporation Tax
fields.helpText: For example, 31 3 2015

fields.label: Date you will prepare your next accounts
fields.helpText: For example, 31 3 2016

sections.title: Is your company a member of a group?

fields.label: Is your company a member of a group?

sections.title: Parent company details

fields.label: Is this the country of tax residence?

sections.title: What is the country of tax residence?

fields.label: What is the country of tax residence?
fields.helpText: This is the country where the company currently pays tax

sections.title: Does your parent company have a company registration number or equivalent?

fields.helpText: This may also be referred to as a reference number and is used to identify a company's legal existence

sections.title: What is the registration number of your parent company?

fields.label: What is the registration number of your parent company?
fields.helpText: We will use this to identify the company

sections.title: Has your company taken over another UK business?

fields.label: Has your company taken over another UK business?

sections.title: Enter the business address

fields.infoText: This is the address of the business that has been transferred to you.

sections.title: Enter the details of the previous business owner

fields.label: Full name
fields.helpText: This is name of the owner (?)

declarationSection.title: Make your declaration and send the form

fields.label: Declaration copy
fields.infoText: By submitting this form you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.

fields.label: Declaration copy
fields.infoText: If you give incomplete or inaccurate information, we may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.

This is your last opportunity to print or save a pdf copy of your submitted report.

We will use the information you have provided to set up a record for the company and send you a Corporation Tax Unique taxpayer Reference. 

When you receive this reference you will also receive a CT41G Form which will include more information about what you need to do next. 

Once you have your CT41G you must go online and subscribe to the Government Gateway and Corporation Tax online return service: (File your accounts and Company Tax Return?)
You will only be able to file your return once you have registered for the Company Tax Return online service.
